trans-unit.source: Contains various utility functions for backward compatibility with Visual Basic 6.0.
The functions in this class are used during the upgrade of Visual Basic 6.0 projects to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
Some functions replace Visual Basic 6.0 functions that are no longer supported in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]; others compensate for differences in the object models.
To use functions in this class in a [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] project, add a reference to the `Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6` namespace.
Duplicates Visual Basic 6.0 functionality of assigning an `Array` to a `Variant`.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `Variant` data type is no longer supported in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
The `CopyArray` function is used by the upgrade tools to copy an `Array` to or from a `Variant` array.

To copy an array in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use the <xref:System.Array.Clone%2A>, <xref:System.Array.Copy%2A> or <xref:System.Array.CopyTo%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Array> class.
A <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.
The array to copy.
Returns an OLE `IPicture` object that corresponds to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Cursor"></xref>.
In Visual Basic 6.0, the `MouseIcon` property of a form or control could be used to load a custom `MousePointer` (cursor).
In some cases, the image for the `MouseIcon` was stored as a `stdOle.IPicture`; this function is used by the upgrade tool to convert a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Cursor> to a `stdOle.IPicture`.

To convert a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Cursor> in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AxHost.GetIPictureFromCursor%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AxHost> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Cursor"></xref> to convert.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the OLE `IPicture` object.
Performs a logical equivalence on two <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> expressions.
If either expression is `Null`, result is also `Null`.
When neither expression is `Null`, result is determined according to the following table:
If expression1 is
And expression2 is
The result is
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `Eqv` operator is no longer a part of the Visual Basic language; use the equals (=) comparison operator in place of `Eqv` for logical evaluations.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the two expressions are equal; otherwise `false`.
Performs a logical equivalence on two <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> expressions.
The `Eqv` operator performs a bitwise comparison of identically positioned bits in two numeric expressions and sets the corresponding bit according to the following table:
If bit in expression1 is
And bit in expression2 is
The result is
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `Eqv` operator is no longer a part of the Visual Basic language; for bitwise evaluations use the `Not` and `XOr` operators.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the result of the bitwise comparison.
Performs a logical equivalence on two <xref href="System.Int16"></xref> expressions.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `Eqv` operator is no longer a part of the Visual Basic language; for bitwise evaluations use the `Not` and `XOr` operators.
A <xref href="System.Int16"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Int16"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Int16"></xref> that contains the result of the comparison.
Performs a logical equivalence on two <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> expressions.

In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `Eqv` operator is no longer a part of the [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] language; for bitwise evaluations use the `Not` and `XOr` operators.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that contains the result of the comparison.
Performs a logical equivalence on two <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> expressions.

In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `Eqv` operator is no longer a part of the [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] language; for bitwise evaluations use the `Not` and `XOr` operators.
A <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> that contains the result of the comparison.
Performs a logical equivalence on two <xref href="System.Object"></xref> expressions.

In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `Eqv` operator is no longer a part of the [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] language; for bitwise evaluations use the `Not` and `XOr` operators.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the result of the comparison.
Changes the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Bold"></xref> style bit for a font.
In Visual Basic 6.0, font styles were applied by setting properties; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] font styles are applied by using a <xref:System.Drawing.FontStyle> enumeration.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to translate the Visual Basic 6.0 properties to the new enumerations.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
`true` to set the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Bold"></xref> style bit; otherwise `false`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> with the new style applied.
Returns a font for a specified GDI character set.
In Visual Basic 6.0, the `stdFont` object had a `CharSet` property that specified the GDI character set for a font.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the character set is specified as an optional of a <xref:System.Drawing.Font> constructor.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert a `stdFont` to a <xref:System.Drawing.Font>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
A byte value that specifies the GDI character set to use.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> for the specified GDI character set.
Changes the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Italic"></xref> style bit for a font.
In Visual Basic 6.0, font styles were applied by setting properties; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] font styles are applied by using a <xref:System.Drawing.FontStyle> enumeration.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to translate the Visual Basic 6.0 properties to the new enumerations.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
`true` to set the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Italic"></xref> style bit; otherwise `false`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> with the new style applied.
Returns a new <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> for a given Visual Basic 6.0 `Font`.

In Visual Basic 6.0, the name of a font was specified by the `Font` property; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Name%2A> is a property of the <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert a Visual Basic 6.0 `Font` to a <xref:System.Drawing.Font>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
A `String` that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `Font` property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that matches the Visual Basic 6.0 `Font`.
Changes the <xref href="System.Drawing.Font.Size"></xref> property for a font.

In Visual Basic 6.0, the size of a font was specified by the `FontSize` property; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], <xref:System.Drawing.Font.Size%2A> is a property of the <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert a Visual Basic 6.0 `Font` to a <xref:System.Drawing.Font>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
A `Single` that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `FontSize` property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that matches the Visual Basic 6.0 `FontSize`.
Changes the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Strikeout"></xref> style bit for a font.
In Visual Basic 6.0, font styles were applied by setting properties; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] font styles are applied by using a <xref:System.Drawing.FontStyle> enumeration.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to translate the Visual Basic 6.0 properties to the new enumerations.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
`true` to set the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Strikeout"></xref> style bit; otherwise `false`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> with the new style applied.
Changes the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Underline"></xref> style bit for a font.
In Visual Basic 6.0, font styles were applied by setting properties; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] font styles are applied by using a <xref:System.Drawing.FontStyle> enumeration.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to translate the Visual Basic 6.0 properties to the new enumerations.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
`true` to set the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontStyle.Underline"></xref> style bit; otherwise `false`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> with the new style applied.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to a Visual Basic 6.0 `stdFont` object.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `stdFont` object was COM-based and has no equivalent in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between a <xref:System.Drawing.Font> and a `stdFont` during project upgrade.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to convert.
A `stdFont` object.
Converts the Visual Basic 6.0 `Format` function to be compatible with [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
The Visual Basic 6.0 `Format` function could operate on a `Variant` data type; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] the `Variant` data type no longer exists.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert a `Variant` formatted by using the `Format` function to a common language runtime-compliant type.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> expression to convert.
Optional.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents a date format.
Optional.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.FirstDayOfWeek"></xref> enumeration.
Optional.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.FirstWeekOfYear"></xref> enumeration.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the formatted data.
Converts a pixel measurement to a Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleHeight` measurement.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the height.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleHeight` for the current `ScaleMode`.
An `Integer` that represents the height in pixels.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the converted Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleHeight`.
Converts a pixel measurement to a Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleWidth` measurement.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the width.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleWidth` for the current `ScaleMode`.
An `Integer` that represents the width in pixels.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the converted Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleWidth`.
Converts a pixel measurement to a Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleLeft` measurement.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the X coordinate.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleLeft` for the current `ScaleMode`.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleWidth` for the current `ScaleMode`.
An `Integer` that represents the width in pixels.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the converted Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleLeft`.
Converts a pixel measurement to a Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleTop` measurement.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the X coordinate.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleTop` for the current `ScaleMode`.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleHeight` for the current `ScaleMode`.
An `Integer` that represents the height in pixels.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the converted Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleTop`.
Converts a pixel measurement to a Visual Basic 6.0 measurement for a given <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ScaleMode"></xref>.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the X coordinate in pixels.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ScaleMode"></xref> enumeration that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleMode` to convert to.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the Visual Basic 6.0 value for the specified `ScaleMode`.
Converts a pixel measurement to a Visual Basic 6.0 measurement for a given <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ScaleMode"></xref>.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Y coordinate in pixels.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ScaleMode"></xref> enumeration that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleMode` to convert to.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the Visual Basic 6.0 value for the specified `ScaleMode`.
Gets the control that currently has focus.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to replace the Visual Basic 6.0 `Screen.ActiveControl` property.
It is the equivalent of calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl.ActiveControl%2A> in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
The control that currently has focus.
Gets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Button"></xref> is the cancel button on a form.
This function is the equivalent of checking the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.CancelButton%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Button"></xref> control.
`true` if btn is the cancel button; otherwise `false`.
Gets sets a value that determines whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Button"></xref> control is the default button on a form.
This function is the equivalent of checking the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.AcceptButton%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Button"></xref> control.
`true` if btn is the default button; otherwise `false`.
Gets the name of the executable file (.exe) for the current application.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the name without a file name extension.
Gets the instance handle (HINSTANCE) for the current application.
This function is the equivalent of calling <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.GetHINSTANCE%2A>.
An <xref href="System.IntPtr"></xref> for the current application instance.
Gets an `Integer` associated with a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox"></xref> item.

In Visual Basic 6.0, the `ItemData` property for a `ListBox` or `ComboBox` control could be set at design time in the **Properties** window to associate an `Integer` with a `ListBox` or `ComboBox` item.

In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `ItemData` property no longer exists; the `GetItemData` and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.Support.SetItemData%2A> methods can be used to emulate the behavior of `ItemData`.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox"></xref> control.
An `Integer` that represents the index of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
The `Integer` associated with the specified <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.String"></xref> associated with a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox"></xref> item.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to emulate the Visual Basic 6.0 `List` property.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.Items%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.Items%2A> property instead.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox"></xref> control.
An `Integer` that represents the index of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> associated with the specified <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
Gets the current path for the application.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the path of the currently executing assembly.
Gets an OLE `IPicture` object for a given <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
In Visual Basic 6.0, an OLE `IPicture` object could be used to specify an icon; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the OLE `IPicture` format is no longer supported.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between an `IPicture` and a <xref:System.Drawing.Icon>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> representing the OLE `IPicture` object.
Converts a Visual Basic 6.0 `stdFont` object to a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref>.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `stdFont` object was COM-based and has no equivalent in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between a <xref:System.Drawing.Font> and a `stdFont` during project upgrade.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains a Visual Basic 6.0 `stdFont`.
A specified object to convert.
Gets an OLE `IPicture` object for a given <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref>.
In Visual Basic 6.0, an OLE `IPicture` object could be used to specify an image; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the OLE `IPicture` format is no longer supported.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between an `IPicture` and a <xref:System.Drawing.Image>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> representing the OLE `IPicture` object.
Gets an OLE `IPictureDisp` object for a given <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref>.
In Visual Basic 6.0, an OLE `IPictureDisp` object could be used to specify an image; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the OLE `IPicture` format is no longer supported.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between an `IPicture` and a <xref:System.Drawing.Image>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> representing the OLE `IPictureDisp` object.
Performs a logical implication on two <xref href="System.Object"></xref> expressions.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `Imp` operator is no longer supported in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to replace the `Imp` operator during project upgrade.
During upgrade, the Variant data type is upgraded to <xref:System.Object>.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use `Not` and `XOr` to replace `Imp`.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> expression.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> expression.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the result.
Performs a logical implication on two <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> expressions.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `Imp` operator is no longer supported in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to replace the `Imp` operator during project upgrade.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use `Not` and `XOr` to replace `Imp`.
A `Long` expression.
A `Long` expression.
A `Long` that contains the result.
Performs a logical implication on two <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> expressions.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `Imp` operator is no longer supported in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to replace the `Imp` operator during project upgrade.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use `Not` and `XOr` to replace `Imp`.
An `Integer` expression.
An `Integer` expression.
An `Integer` that contains the result.
Performs a logical implication on two <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> expressions.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `Imp` operator is no longer supported in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to replace the `Imp` operator during project upgrade.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use `Not` and `XOr` to replace `Imp`.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> expression.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> expression.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the result.
Performs a logical implication on two <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> expressions.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `Imp` operator is no longer supported in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to replace the `Imp` operator during project upgrade.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use `Not` and `XOr` instead of `Imp`.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> expression.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> expression.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that contains the result.
Performs a logical implication on two <xref href="System.Int16"></xref> expressions.
The Visual Basic 6.0 `Imp` operator is no longer supported in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to replace the `Imp` operator during project upgrade.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use `Not` and `XOr` to replace `Imp`.
A `Short` expression.
A `Short` expression.
A `Short` that contains the result.
Gets an <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> for a given OLE `IPictureDisp` object.
In Visual Basic 6.0, an OLE `IPictureDisp` object could be used to specify an image; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the OLE `IPicture` format is no longer supported.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between an `IPictureDisp` and a <xref:System.Drawing.Image>.
An OLE `IPictureDisp` object.
An image object.
Gets an <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> for a given OLE `IPicture` object.
In Visual Basic 6.0, an OLE `IPicture` object could be used to specify an image; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the OLE `IPicture` format is no longer supported.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between an `IPicture` and a <xref:System.Drawing.Image>.
An OLE `IPicture` object.
A converted object to image.
Loads data of several possible types from a resource (.res) file.
In Visual Basic 6.0, international versions of an application were created by putting all localizable information, such as strings, into a separate resource file (.res) for each language.
At run time, locale-specific resources were loaded from the resource file by calling the `LoadResString`, `LoadResPicture`, and `LoadResData` functions.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], international versions of an application are created by changing the `Language` property of a form at design time.
A separate resource file (.resx) is automatically created for each locale selected.
You no longer have to explicitly load resources from code; resources are automatically loaded based on the user's locale.
For more information, see [Globalizing Windows Forms](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/globalizing-windows-forms.md).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the data in the resource file.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the resource type.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the resource.
Loads data of several possible types from a resource (.res) file, specifying a locale.
In Visual Basic 6.0, international versions of an application were created by putting all localizable information, such as strings, into a separate resource file (.res) for each language.
At run time, locale-specific resources were loaded from the resource file by calling the `LoadResString`, `LoadResPicture`, and `LoadResData` functions.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], international versions of an application are created by changing the `Language` property of a form at design time.
A separate resource file (.resx) is automatically created for each locale selected.
You no longer have to explicitly load resources from code; resources are automatically loaded based on the user's locale.
For more information, see [Globalizing Windows Forms](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/globalizing-windows-forms.md).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the data in the resource file.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the resource type.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that specifies the locale.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the resource.
Loads a bitmap, icon, or cursor from a resource (.res) file.
In Visual Basic 6.0, international versions of an application were created by putting all localizable information, such as strings, into a separate resource file (.res) for each language.
At run time, locale-specific resources were loaded from the resource file by calling the `LoadResString`, `LoadResPicture`, and `LoadResData` functions.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], international versions of an application are created by changing the `Language` property of a form at design time.
A separate resource file (.resx) is automatically created for each locale selected.
You no longer have to explicitly load resources from code; resources are automatically loaded based on the user's locale.
For more information, see [Globalizing Windows Forms](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/globalizing-windows-forms.md).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the data in the resource file.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.LoadResConstants"></xref> enumeration that specifies the resource type.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the resource.
Loads a bitmap, icon, or cursor from a resource (.res) file, specifying a locale.
In Visual Basic 6.0, international versions of an application were created by putting all localizable information, such as strings, into a separate resource file (.res) for each language.
At run time, locale-specific resources were loaded from the resource file by calling the `LoadResString`, `LoadResPicture`, and `LoadResData` functions.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], international versions of an application are created by changing the `Language` property of a form at design time.
A separate resource file (.resx) is automatically created for each locale selected.
You no longer have to explicitly load resources from code; resources are automatically loaded based on the user's locale.
For more information, see [Globalizing Windows Forms](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/globalizing-windows-forms.md).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the data in the resource file.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.LoadResConstants"></xref> enumeration that specifies the resource type.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that specifies the locale.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the resource.
Loads a string from a resource (.res) file.

At run time, locale-specific resources were loaded from the resource file by calling the `LoadResString`, `LoadResPicture`, and `LoadResData` functions.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], international versions of an application are created by changing the `Language` property of a form at design time.
A separate resource file (.resx) is automatically created for each locale selected.
You no longer have to explicitly load resources from code; resources are automatically loaded based on the user's locale.
For more information, see [Globalizing Windows Forms](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/globalizing-windows-forms.md).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the data in the resource file.

Loads a string from a resource (.res) file, specifying a locale.
In Visual Basic 6.0, international versions of an application were created by putting all localizable information, such as strings, into a separate resource file (.res) for each language.
At run time, locale-specific resources were loaded from the resource file by calling the `LoadResString`, `LoadResPicture`, and `LoadResData` functions.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], international versions of an application are created by changing the `Language` property of a form at design time.
A separate resource file (.resx) is automatically created for each locale selected.
You no longer have to explicitly load resources from code; resources are automatically loaded based on the user's locale.
For more information, see [Globalizing Windows Forms](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/globalizing-windows-forms.md).
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the data in the resource file.

Converts an X coordinate from pixels to twips.
In Visual Basic 6.0, coordinates were expressed in twips; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] they are expressed in pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between the two coordinate systems.
A `Double` that contains the X coordinate to convert.
A `Double` that contains the X coordinate expressed in twips.
Converts a Y coordinate from pixels to twips.
In Visual Basic 6.0, coordinates were expressed in twips; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] they are expressed in pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between the two coordinate systems.
A `Double` that contains the Y coordinate to convert.
A `Double` that contains the Y coordinate expressed in twips.
Sends one or more keystrokes to the active window as if typed at the keyboard.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to emulate the Visual Basic 6.0 `SendKeys` method.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use the `My.Computer.Keyboard.SendKeys` method instead.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the key values.
`true` to process keystrokes before control is returned to the procedure; otherwise `false`.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form.CancelButton"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form"></xref>.
In Visual Basic 6.0, the Boolean `Default` and `Cancel` properties of a `CommandButton` control determine whether the control responds to the ENTER or ESC keys, respectively.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control no longer has `Default` or `Cancel` properties.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> object has <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.AcceptButton%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.CancelButton%2A> properties that provide the same functionality; these properties take the name of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control as an argument.

This function is used by the upgrade tools to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.CancelButton%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.based on the `Cancel` property of an upgraded Visual Basic 6.0 `CommandButton` control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Button"></xref>.
`true` if the Visual Basic 6.0 `CommandButton` control's `Cancel` property is `true`; otherwise `false`.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form.AcceptButton"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form"></xref>.
In Visual Basic 6.0, the Boolean `Default` and `Cancel` properties of a `CommandButton` control determine whether the control responds to the ENTER or ESC keys, respectively.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control no longer has `Default` or `Cancel` properties.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> object has <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.AcceptButton%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.CancelButton%2A> properties that provide the same functionality; these properties take the name of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control as an argument.

This function is used by the upgrade tools to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.AcceptButton%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.based on the `Default` property of an upgraded Visual Basic 6.0 `CommandButton` control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Button"></xref>.
`true` if the Visual Basic 6.0 `CommandButton` control's `Default` property is `true`; otherwise `false`.
Sets the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem.ItemData"></xref> property for a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem"></xref>.

In Visual Basic 6.0, the `ItemData` property for a `ListBox` or `ComboBox` control could be set at design time in the **Properties** window to associate an `Integer` with a `ListBox` or `ComboBox` item.

In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `ItemData` property no longer exists; the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.Support.GetItemData%2A> and `SetItemData` methods can be used to emulate the behavior of `ItemData`.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox"></xref> control.
The `Index` of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
An `Integer` to assign to the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem.ItemData"></xref> property.
Sets the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem.ItemString"></xref> property for a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to emulate the Visual Basic 6.0 `List` property.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.Items%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.Items%2A> property instead.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref><xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox"></xref> control.
The `Index` of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> to assign to the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem.ItemString"></xref> property.
Assigns the name of a Visual Basic 6.0 resource file to the current [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] project namespace.
Resource handling is different for Visual Basic 6.0 and [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to add a Visual Basic 6.0 resource file to a project.
A resource file (.res).
Assigns the name of a Visual Basic 6.0 resource file to a [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] project namespace.
Resource handling is different for Visual Basic 6.0 and [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
This function is used by the upgrade tools to add a Visual Basic 6.0 resource file to a project.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the `Namespace` for the resource file.
A resource file (.res).
Displays a form by calling either the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Show"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form.ShowDialog"></xref> method.

In Visual Basic 6.0, the `Show` method specified whether a Form would be displayed modally; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] it is replaced by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Show%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.ShowDialog%2A> methods.

This function is used by the upgrade tools to map the Visual Basic 6.0 `Show` method to either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Show%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.ShowDialog%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form"></xref> to display.
Optional.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FormShowConstants"></xref> enumeration that specifies modality.
Optional.
The owner parameter of the method.
Formats strings to simulate the Visual Basic 6.0 `Debug.Print` functionality.
In Visual Basic 6.0, the `Debug.Print` method had an `outputlist` parameter that specified how output was formatted in the **Immediate** window.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to translate the `outputlist` parameter into a string for display in the **Immediate** window.
An expression or list of expressions to print.
A formatted <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
Converts a Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleHeight` measurement to a pixel measurement.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the height.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleHeight` for the current `ScaleMode`.
An `Integer` that represents the height in pixels.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the converted Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleHeight`.
Converts a Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleWidth` measurement to a pixel measurement.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the width.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleWidth` for the current `ScaleMode`.
An `Integer` that represents the width in pixels.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the converted Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleWidth`.
Converts a Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleLeft` measurement to a pixel measurement.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the X coordinate.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleLeft` for the current `ScaleMode`.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleWidth` for the current `ScaleMode`.
An `Integer` that represents the width in pixels.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the converted Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleLeft`.
Converts a Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleTop` measurement to a pixel measurement.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Y coordinate.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleTop` for the current `ScaleMode`.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleHeight` for the current `ScaleMode`.
An `Integer` that represents the height in pixels.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the converted Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleLeft`.
Converts a Visual Basic 6.0 measurement to a pixel measurement for a given <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ScaleMode"></xref>.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the X coordinate.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ScaleMode"></xref> enumeration that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleMode` to convert from.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the pixel value for the specified `ScaleMode`.
Converts a Visual Basic 6.0 measurement to a pixel measurement for a given <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ScaleMode"></xref>.
Visual Basic 6.0 supported multiple coordinate systems defined by a `ScaleMode` property.
This included a user-defined value.
[!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] only supports a coordinate system that is based on pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between pixels and a user-defined scale value.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the Y coordinate.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ScaleMode"></xref> enumeration that represents the Visual Basic 6.0 `ScaleMode` to convert from.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that contains the pixel value for the specified `ScaleMode`.
Gets a value that is used to convert twips to pixels based on screen settings.
In Visual Basic 6.0, coordinates were expressed in twips; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] they are expressed in pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between the two coordinate systems.
A `Double` that contains the conversion factor.
Gets a value that is used to convert twips to pixels based on screen settings.
In Visual Basic 6.0, coordinates were expressed in twips; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] they are expressed in pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between the two coordinate systems.
A `Double` that contains the conversion factor.
Converts an X coordinate from twips to pixels.
In Visual Basic 6.0, coordinates were expressed in twips; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] they are expressed in pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between the two coordinate systems.
A `Double` that contains the X coordinate to convert.
A `Double` that contains the X coordinate expressed in pixels.
Converts a Y coordinate from twips to pixels.
In Visual Basic 6.0, coordinates were expressed in twips; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] they are expressed in pixels.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to convert between the two coordinate systems.
A `Double` that contains the X coordinate to convert.
A `Double` that contains the Y coordinate expressed in pixels.
Emulates the behavior of the Visual Basic 6.0 `ValidateControls` method.
In Visual Basic 6.0, the `ValidateControls` method was used to force the `Validate` event for the control that has focus when a form is closed; if the `Validate` event fails, an error was raised.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the `ValidateControls` method is replaced by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl.Validate%2A> method, which returns `true` or `false`.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to emulate the Visual Basic 6.0 behavior.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl"></xref> where the control is parented.
Displays pop-up Help for a form upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Pop-up Help in Visual Basic 6.0 was implemented by using the `WhatsThisButton` and `WhatsThisHelp` properties of a form; pop-up Help in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] is implemented by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.HelpButton%2A> property of a form.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to change the method of displaying pop-up Help in an upgraded application.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form"></xref>.
Converts the Visual Basic `ZOrder` method for use in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].

In Visual Basic 6.0, the `ZOrder` method was used to specify the layering of controls; in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] .it is replaced by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BringToFront%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.SendToBack%2A> methods.
This function is used by the upgrade tools to map between the methods.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref>.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ZOrderConstants"></xref> enumeration.
